About Me

I am a Computer Science student studying at Mount San Antonio College. My ultimate goal is to become a well rounded software developer and make a meaningful impact through my skills. I love rock climbing, beach rock, and javascript.

Classwork Stack

Right now I'm using mostly these languages to complete coursework. I am most familiar and comfortable with them at the moment.

Code

I'm currently spending most of my time learning and trying to build projects using Javascript and some of it's essential tools including React and Node.

Tools

Through group project work at my first hackathon as well as through the Chingu Cohorts, I have learned and utilized essential developmemt tools.

Projects

Paperbot.ai Site Clone
  • Git
  • HTML/JS/CSS
  • Group Collaboration

This project, started from a Chingu Learners Cohort, was created by me and two other students looking to learn through creating. We jumped straight in and decided to recreate this site from scratch together, effectively attemping to reverse engineer it, in turn picking up any frameworks or tools we needed.

Check it out
MediScore
  • Git + Github
  • React.js
  • Heroku
  • Google Maps API

This project was created in a team of four at Biola Hacks 2017. We utilized the John Snow Labs medical datasets and the Google Maps API in order to assign hospitals a score based on criteria ranked from most to least important by the user. This project tought me alot about the component structure of react.js, as well as deeper working knowledge of git through solving version issues. This event opened my eyes to tools and methods to development that I never knew existed.

Check it out
